reviews:
Let me start off by saying that I have a problem when it comes to flashlights. I have a collection of over 30 different flashlights from all the big brands. This little flashlight is my go-to 9 out of 10 times. The 920 lumen output is not an exaggeration. When on turbo mode (max brightness), it easily outshines other brand flashlights claiming to be 1000+ lumens.
The buttons are a designed perfectly. While some flashlights have a single power/brightness button requiring you to turn the flashlight off and on several times to get to the desired brightness, this flashlight has the power button on the end and the brightness controls on the body. As the product page indicates, there are 5x brightness levels of the main LED and one level for the red LED. In order to change between the brightness levels you simply press the button closer to the front to increase and closer to the back to decrease. If you decrease the brightness past the lowest level the red LED turns on. If you hold down either of the buttons by themselves instead of pressing and releasing, it will change directly to the brightest mode or the red LED without having to go through the steps. I typically use this when wanting to switch to the red LED without having to press a button multiple times.
Which brings me to the red LED. This is one of the few flashlights I could find that includes a red LED. This mode is perfect if you are outside in the dark and need to see where you're going but don't want to create too much light. It's not nearly as noticeable or distracting as a while LED.
Finally, I find the size to be perfect when doing other tasks with your hands that require a flashlight. It is so compact and lightweight that it makes it remarkably easy to carry. It I am carrying it in a pocket, I often forget it's there. At the same time, it does not feel too small that I'm worried I might drop it, nor does it feel delicate or fragile.
The only potential negative for some would be that it uses a smaller battery than most flashlights. If you have an existing charger, make sure it can charge 18350 batteries. Otherwise, purchase a charger that can.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer
meta_data: {'product dimensions': '9.12 x 2.54 x 2.54 cm; 56.98 Grams', 'batteries': '1 Lithium ion batteries required.', 'item model number': 'MT10C', 'is discontinued by manufacturer': 'No', 'color': 'Red', 'bulb type': 'LED', 'material': 'Anodized Aluminum', 'power source': 'Battery', 'included components': 'Flashlight, Keychain Light', 'batteries included?': 'No', 'battery description': '18350, CR123', 'brand': 'Nitecore', 'item weight': '56.9 g'}

reviews:
Great EDC light. on max setting, it is devastatingly bright. the The clip is reversible, so it could be easily clipped on the bill of a hat. The only problem, the clip in the middle, so it leaves the light half in, half out of a pocket, but the clip grip is very firm. this little thing is so awesome for its price, still worthy of 5 stars.

bottom line - this light will exceed your expectations. if it had a tailcap for a remote switch and a picatinny rail mount, it would be a superb weapon light, and then would excel at literally everything one would require this light to do.

UPDATE 5-26-19: I have now lost this light 5 times. This 5th time, it has not been found. The clip on this light is horrible. It leaves half of this light out of your pocket, regardless of how it is clipped, or how tight the clip is, you will find it missing from your pocket. It catches EVERYTHING. This light needs a redesign to fix this, then it will be the perfect EDC all-purpose light. Until then, 3 stars.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews:
I've had my MT10C light for over 9 months. It's been in my right front pocket next to my wallet the entire time. I generally use the 70 lumen setting as it's enough light for most purposes. Being able to easily crank up the output if required is one of the great features.
I do use the red led option at night around the house. We got a puppy this Spring and while she was being housebroken there were accidents. Red gave me the ability to see where I was stepping without disturbing others.
The ability to use the light itself to tell me how much power it left in the battery is comforting as well.

The only drawback I've found is that there isn't any good battery cases that will handle a single 18350 battery as I like to have a spare on me. Currently I'm dealing with the extra bulk of a County Comm 18650 battery case to hold an 18350 plus a CR123 battery as well as that plastic sleeve which is supposed to reduce the rattling when you're using a CR123.

I picked up a charger as well so I've got 3 cells in rotation, 1 in the light, 1 in the holder in my pocket and 1 on my nightstand. I'd have been fine with 2 cells but the other charger came with 2 so I wasn't complaining (great deal).

While camping last month I did use the light to settle down some kids (junior high to high school age) who were running down the road at the campground at night. 70 lumens was enough to stop them in their tracks as they didn't realize that we (my girlfriend, puppy and myself) were walking on the road ahead of them in the dark. I know that a higher output would have been better but I wanted light RIGHT NOW. It was easy to pull it out of my pocket and hit the switch.

Yes, for what's currently out there I consider this to be my perfect EDC light.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews:
I love the compactness of this flashlight! It's super small, and you can "hide" it in your fist if you need to. Sometimes to perform security duties for me place of worship and this helps out tons! I use the low settings the most to light up the ground so that the friends can safely make it to the door at night.

In a pinch I would say the strobe would incapacitate someone to give you extra time to get away from an assailant. Never had to yet, but good to know that you could. The red LED is fantastic at night if you need to read something in the car, or look for your cellphone that fell in between the seat and center console...

The batter life is meh. I plan to upgrade to a longer life battery in the future, but not on the top of my list of things to do. The machining and tooling of this flashlight is waay better than the ShureFire that I lost. Win/Win!
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews:
I have a couple Nitecore lights for EDC. I also have lights from Klarus, Olight, Thrunite, and others. This is by far my favorite EDC light, one that I carry every day. I love the up and down brightness buttons, the "candlelight" setting, the red map light setting, and the very, very nice end cap press switch. If I didn't already have all my ARs and shotguns equipped with other lights I'd consider using this one for tactical purposes, too.

Yeah. Small, light, bright, tough. Can't go wrong.

P.S. -- forgot to mention that this is the 2nd one of these I got. The first one went to a wheelchair buddy who saw me using it and asked for one of his own. I gave him the one connected to my pocket lanyard and ordered another as soon as I got home. I'd do the same thing in an instant.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: What an awesome little flashlight. I needed a flashlight to carry with me wherever I go and I wanted something small. Some of my co-workers really like flashlights and specifically recommended this one to me so I bit the bullet. When it came I was pleasantly surprised that it was exactly the size I was looking for. Im also happy that the clip it comes with appears very sturdy so I can clip it to my pants pocket and don't have to worry that it's going to fall. I like all the modes too, the red light is perfect for checking a quick document at night when you don't want to lose your night vision or don't want broadcast your location. This flashlight is now my primary backup flashlight at work. I did also buy the nitecore recharger but haven't used it yet.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: I'm a bit of a flashlight geek- always have been and you aren't going to change that. LOL. I have too many flashlights- mostly Nitecore, Olight, and Thrunight. This little light is a great light. I love the tail switch for quickness of use in the dark. You find the end- you find the on switch. I like the light levels too. The one lumen is enough to see close up, and the 960 has a great throw for such a little light. It's my favorite EDC light. I use nothing but the IMR which came with it, along with RCR123R (rechargeables) and haven't had any issues.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: This light checks all the boxes and then some for what an edc light should be and have. Instant turbo? Check! Instant red night light? Check! Instant strobe? Check! Itâ€™s got great flood and decent throw. Itâ€™s very short, and therefore, very pocketable. No need to fumble around in the dark looking for the side switches cuz the side switches can easily be found even when youâ€™re wearing gloves. I have at least a dozen other flashlights (Nitecore, Fenix, Lumintop, BLF, Olight, and Thrunite) and theyâ€™re all great. But theyâ€™re all either missing at least one or two features or theyâ€™re just not very pocketable or their navigation through the brightness cycles are just too inconvenient. This MT10C addresses and this and provides them to you. I think writing this review just convinced me to buy another one to use as a backup.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: Purchased March, 2019, paying $40 and treated well by attaching to car key fob placed only in pocket or on the counter, yet this excellent light lasted only 10 month! I plan to contact Nitcore and let them know of this. Will post later their response. After all the excellent reviews as well as my own experience in treating this small flashlight, it may turn out to be as most of the cheap junk from China, a waste. Hope not.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: I haven't had it very long but it works great and is very bright. Very easy to change the brightness. The only thing I don't like is the pocket clip. Mine rubs the light when you turn it to change the battery. I can't get it to slide over my pocket. It may be this one clip isn't made right I don't know. I've never had a clip not to work. I own many lights similar to this one and it seems well made and seems as good as my other ones.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: Dont normally leave reviews.. but had to share with this one. I'm an EDC guy, I have every flashlite I can think of. Streamlights, olights, and everything in between. THIS IS MY FAVORITE LIGHT!! Its light weight. Bright. And doesnt cost me an arm and a leg. Plus it comes with a rechargeable battery. The nylon case is a joke but I dont wear my light. I just drop it my pocket and dont know it's there till I need it. If your looking for a perfect reliable EDC light.. BUY IT!!!
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: I bought this flashlight first because it was on sale, and second because I love small single cell flashlights that give off a bunch of light. This one certainly puts out the light using just the single 18650 Li ion battery. It has quickly become my flashlight of choice for dog walks and pulling in the bird feeders at night. The beam is a little on the floody side, but it lights up my backyard quite nicely. The only unknown at this point is battery life, but since I have a cradle charger it won't be much of an issue.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: The problem with most of the push-button tactical lights is that the control is done through a sequence of pushing the main on/off button which can present a problem if you accidentally push the button one-too-many times or shut it off in a mode you don't want. This light solves that issue by having the light modes changed by separate control buttons. Very intuitive button controls and nice red light option. Great, sturdy product.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

review_title: Don't buy if you intend on daily carrying.
reviews: This light lasted less than 2 months before the switch on back failed.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

review_title: Perfect. Turn it on, boom. Compact.
reviews:
Perfect. Threw away two other led flashlights I got cheap. I can no longer stand having to cycle a power button through 5-7 modes just to turn the damned things on.

This is the best flashlight I have ever had, wow. Turn it on- boom. On. Super compact, and insanely bright when I need it. The red led mode is a cool bonus I likely will not do without.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: I have very little experience with this light since I just used it once so far, but this light is prefect to have in your pocket when outdoors hiking or camping. Toss a lanyard on it that hangs out of your pocket for quick retrieval. I really like the tail clicky for the on and off, then having the side buttons for setting adjustment. This light is small, light and powerful! Highly recommend for someone that needs something small with good power.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

review_title: Liked it so much I got an extra one.
reviews: Such a powerful and versatile light for its size. I like the ability of this light to use rechargeable batteries as well as standard cr123a batteries. Mode memory is great and controls are super intuitive. I got one for camping but it ended up living on my rifle so I got another one. Perfect size flashlight with power when you need it and super long battery life at lower output.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: I liked the size and brightness of the light. It did not come with a charger, only a rechargeable battery. When I tried to find either a charger for the battery or a replacement battery, our local battery store did not have either and didn't know where to get them. The light, therefore, became instantly useless for us despite its performance.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

review_title: Lotta bite for a small pup
reviews: I love Nitecore lights, I think they are innovators and their lights in general are very well thought out. You get a ton of light from this thing, you could easily blind someone who was trying to attack you, so for self protection it has a lot of value. And for sheer utility, this again is a lot of bang for the buck. Get it!!
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

review_title: Use the case or hand strap it's easy to loose from a pocket!
reviews: This thing is bright! Aside from the stobe/flash settings I use them all. I have a $300 surefire which is adjustable and doesn't have the range that this little $35 flashlight has.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: This light is small and man O Man is it bright! I love the red constant and red flash mode which is great for maintaining your night vision without interruption. I got mine as the price slowly started to climb which was an awesome value. I would pay double for it and still be happy. Buy One!
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: This is a good little light. My only complaint is that the pocket clip isn't full length so it will stick up out of your pocket flap when in your pocket. I prefer to have it in the same spot all the time but as this is my back up, it will simply ride down in the bottom of my pocket & when I need it i'll fish it out.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: For $40 it is very compact and worked great for 2days. The light has two buttons to adjust the intensity of the light. That broke on the second day and it is stuck on the lowest luminosity setting. The red light was cool when it worked. I bought 2 slightly larger flashlights for $14 ($7 a piece) from another company that work great with AAA batteries. This junk light uses a special battery that will probably cost $10 to replace or $20 for the charger. It does not come with the charger. $40 for a light that works with a charger and rechargeable battery would be worth it. I just have a $40 paper weight now.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: This my third NiteCore light. This one is ideal for keeping in my glove compartment of the car for emergencies. I like the intuitive and simple controls on Nitecore products. With some other brands it's like learning a new OS to use the darn things. I don't want to have to refer to a manual everytime I want to use a freaking flashlight!! Good job!
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: I own 10 different Nitecore flashlights and this little one is fast becoming one of my favorites. I walk my dogs at night and live in a very dark area with coyotes, it necessary I have a good flashlight and this is a good mid-range flashlight that fits easily in my pocket.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

Dual direction clip, lightweight, hides in your hand like a roll of quarters, and amazingly bright and functional. Multiple brightness levels with easy up down buttons and the red light for night work is a bonus. This bad boy is my new EDC !!
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews:
This flashlight was everything I needed for camping and just general use.

BUT
The electronics in this thing bugged out after about two weeks and now it's stuck on on brightness setting and the red light doesn't work. It's fine, but disappointing! You definitely get what you pay for.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: This light is very bright for an EDC, but I find it a bit chunky for pocket carry. The UI is the best and easiest-to-use I've encountered, which goes a long way. The clicky switch means it doesn't accidentally activate in one's pocket - a big advantage over similar lights I've carried.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: Great light. Small and lite. The reversible clip is a good feature. The clip is also strong so I can clip it to by hat and not worry about it falling off when I turn my head. This is actually my second one. Carried another light for a while. Going back to this one. Key features for me are the clip, small size light output, and the tail switch. The red light and the very low setting are also awesome.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: My boyfriend works for UPS and uses this to find boxes in the truck at night. The battery life lasts sooooooo long and super bright.

reviews: I have quit a few mini/small flashlights and this one is definitely one off the better ones. I especially like the way the dual switchs work and the lowest level of brightness being as low as it is (moonlite) is nice for looking at something close. The small size doesn't give up any brightness either.
product_name: Nitecore MT10C 920 Lumen Multitask Tactical Flashlight with Red Light, Rechargeable Battery, and LumenTac Battery Organizer
